meanings.definition: To surpass in argument or debate by using clever reasoning or deception.
meanings.sent1: She outcaviled her opponent in the debate by presenting strong evidence.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outcavil others by using tricky arguments.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox outcaviled the sly rabbit in their argument about who found the juiciest berries.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outcavil her classmates made her the undisputed champion of the debate club.
meanings.sent5: The detective outcaviled the suspect by uncovering the hidden truth with his sharp reasoning skills.

meanings.definition: To outdo in cunning or deceitful behavior.
meanings.sent1: The con artist outcaviled his victims by convincing them to trust him with their money.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to outcavil her competitors in the business world.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon outcaviled the other animals by stealing the most food from the campsite.
meanings.sent4: The cunning spy outcaviled his enemies by using disguises and false identities.
meanings.sent5: The magician outcaviled the audience with his clever tricks and illusions.
